title: Business Live: VW bets on electric cars - BBC News
summary: nissan apologises for quality control scandal .
carillion issues third profit warning this year .
tesla unveils its electric big-rig truck .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for another week .
please join us again on monday from 06:00 .

documents.title: will murdoch break up 21st century fox ?
text: one share that did well today was that of the murdoch media empire , 21st century fox .
shares were up more than 6 % by the close .
world service 's world business report has been talking to steven barnett , professor of communications at the university of westminster in london .
clearly companies are trying to get that golden combination of both content and distribution because that 's where `` the big success stories of the future are going to be '' he says .
but it 's hard to believe rupert murdoch would just sit back and let that happen .
`` murdoch has never in his history been on the receiving end .
he 's been the predator .
he 's never been the prey so to speak .

`` if this is true , and it 's still possible that we 're talking about smoke and mirrors here , but if these talks are genuine and if it really is in play then it is a very big deal for the empire that murdoch has brought up . ''
you can listen to the whole interview here .

documents.title: wall street by numbers
text: the final figures on the market close :
the dow jones industrial average was down 100 points , or 0.43 % , at 23,358 .
the s & p 500 was down just 6 points , or 0.26 % , at 2,578and the nasdaq composite was down 10 points , or 0.15 % , at 6,782 .

documents.title: wall street closes down after worries over tax plan 's progress
text: wall street indexes closed lower after investor skepticism about the republicans ' efforts to pass the tax bill .

the house of representatives took important steps on thursday toward the biggest us tax-code overhaul since the 1980s , approving a broad package of cuts , while a senate panel advanced its own version of the legislation .
tax debate shifts to the senate , where the plan has already faced resistance and the republican majority is much slimmer .
`` the market is still kind of nervous with respect to the tax bill moving to the next stage , '' said massud ghaussy , director at nasdaq advisory services .
`` the gop can afford only two defections and they are not expecting any democrats to vote for it . ''

documents.title: germany bans children 's smartwatches
text: a german regulator has banned the sale of smartwatches aimed at children , describing them as spying devices .
it had previously banned an internet-connected doll called , my friend cayla , for similar reasons .
telecoms regulator the federal network agency urged parents who had such watches to destroy them .
one expert said the decision could be a `` game-changer '' for internet-connected devices .
read more here .

documents.title: dawn butler : austerity 'hits ethnic minority women hardest '
text: austerity has hit ethnic minority women hardest , labour 's shadow minister for women and equalities has said .
dawn butler called on the chancellor to publish an equality impact assessment of the budget , ahead of his speech next wednesday .
the brent central mp said labour would boost income and tackle discrimination .
the conservatives said figures showed inequality was at a 30-year low and employment for black and ethnic minority people close to record highs .

documents.title: the degrees that make you rich and the ones that do n't
text: hundreds of thousands of young people are in the process of applying to university , in time for a 2018 start .
their choices can make a huge difference to future earnings .
for most university graduates , having a degree pays .
over the course of a lifetime , estimates suggest women can expect to earn about £ 250,000 more if they have a degree , while the figure is roughly £ 170,000 for men .
in england , higher tuition fees mean that , on average , students graduate with debts of more than £ 50,000 - much more than their counterparts in scotland , wales and northern ireland .
read more here .

documents.title: brexit : eu gives may two weeks to act on divorce bill and ireland
text: theresa may has been told she has two weeks to put more money on the table if the eu is to agree to begin brexit trade talks before the end of the year .
eu council president donald tusk said he was `` ready '' to move onto the next phase of brexit talks , covering future relations with the uk .
but he said the uk must show much more progress on the `` divorce bill '' and the irish border by early next month .
mrs may said `` good progress '' was being made but more needed to be done .
read more here .

documents.title: apple delays launch of smart speaker
text: apple is delaying the release of its homepod smart speaker until 2018 .
the electronics giant said the device , which was due to be released in december this year , still needed development work .
it said the homepod would be ready to go on shop shelves in the us , uk and australia `` early in 2018 '' .
the news is a blow to its plans to take on rivals amazon and google in the growing market for home devices that use ai to help consumers .
read more here .

documents.title: electric cars 'not ready for mass production yet ' says toyota chairman
text: battery-powered cars are not ready for mass production yet , the chairman of toyota has told germna publication der spiegel .
he that he does not see us electric vehicle pioneer tesla as a role model .
`` battery-powered cars with a long range are very expensive and it takes a long time to charge them , '' takeshi uchiyamada was quoted as saying .
`` such cars do not fit in our programme . ''

documents.title: what is the brexit divorce bill ?
text: the brexit divorce bill : what is it , how much is it , and when 's the deadline to agree on it ?
@ twitterid has the answers from both sides of the argument
nil and today

documents.title: uk stocks fall as carillion crashes and sky soars
text: uk stocks fell back into negative territory , ending a short-lived recovery , as takeover interest boosted sky and construction firm carillion plummeted 47 % after warning it would breach debt covenants .
the share index closed at down 0.08 % at 7,380 points .

documents.title: irish demand post-brexit border promise
text: irish demand post-brexit border promise

documents.title: fox shares rise on bid rumours
text: shares in rupert murdoch 's 21st century fox are more than 4 % higher after reports suggest both comcast and verizon are interested in buying parts of the us media giant .
that comes after reports last week that walt disney was also interested in the firm 's film and cable television business .

documents.title: panama 's trump ocean club 'has links to organised crime '
text: a building bearing the trump name - the trump ocean club international hotel and tower in panama city - has ties to brokers , customers and investors linked to drug trafficking and international crime , reports nbc news .

while there is no indication the trump organization or family either engaged in or knew about any criminal activity , they also never asked any questions about buyers of apartments in the building , or where the money was coming from , the article says .

documents.title: tusk gives uk two-week deadline on irish border and brexit payment
text: the president of the eu council , donald tusk , has said that `` more progress '' is needed from the uk on the issues of the irish border and the uk 's financial settlement with the eu in order to proceed to the next phase of the brexit negotiations .
speaking at a jobs summit in sweden , he added : `` i made it very clear to the prime minister may that this progress needs to happen at the beginning of december at the latest . ''

documents.title: 'number of casualties ' in uk helicopter and aircraft crash
text: helicopter involved in mid-air collision with an aircraft over waddesdon , buckinghamshire
a `` number of casualties '' reported after helicopter & aircraft collide mid-air in buckinghamshire
@ thamesvp confirms 4 people died after light aircraft and helicopter collided in mid-air over buckinghamshire
i will # design # professional # unique # businesslogo # superfast
i will # design # professional # unique # businesslogo # superfast

documents.title: us urges african countries to press north korea over nuclear programme
text: us secretary of state rex tillerson has asked african leaders to put pressure pressure north korea to end its nuclear and missile programs , including downgrading diplomatic ties and expelling north korean laborers .
`` all nations must act to implement u.n. sanctions in full , '' tillerson told a trade and security gathering with african ministers .

`` further , i urge you to take additional measures to pressure the dprk by downgrading your diplomatic relationships with the regime , severing economic ties , expelling all dprk laborers and reducing north korea 's presence in your country . ''
the us state department said on thursday that sudan had committed to severing trade and military ties with north korea .

documents.title: wells fargo sacks consumer lending head franklin codel
text: wells fargo has fired its head of consumer lending over an inappropriate communication with a former executive over that person 's being fired .

it 's another bout of upheaval at a lender scandals by scandals since september last year , when government investigators found that employees opened as many as two million accounts without customers ' knowledge to meet sales targets .

documents.title: hornby - is that light at the end of the tunnel ?
text: hornby has said its half year loss before tax rose to £ 5.7m compared with £ 4.7m in the same period in 2016 .
but it said it had a new strategy which includes spending £ 1m on product development and buying a stake in lcd enterprises , the holding company of oxford diecast .

documents.title: vw bets the farm on electrification and self-driving vehicles
text: vw is going to spend more than €34bn ( £ 30bn ) on electric cars , autonomous driving and new mobility services by the end of 2022 , it says .

`` with the planning round now approved , we are laying the foundation for making volkswagen the world 's number one player in electric mobility by 2025 , '' chief executive matthias mueller said in a statement .

documents.title: carillion is on government radar
text: carillion may not be a household name since it was spun off from tarmac in the late 1990s , but is a major partner to the government , including contracts to build parts of hs2 , and manage nearly 900 schools .
it is the uk 's second largest construction company and employs 43,000 people worldwide .
for all that , at the end of this year , the company will owe ten times more than the entire company is worth today .
read more here .

documents.title: the budget in graphics
text: the budget is just days away and chancellor philip hammond faces a difficult balancing act between getting rid of the uk 's deficit while facing calls to increase public spending .
the institute for fiscal studies ( ifs ) sets out the challenges facing mr hammond through a series of graphics
6 key charts ahead of the budget .
chart 1 : the government is spending around £ 50bn more than it raises in revenue .
# budget2017 @ twitterid
# econ2 what 's happened to the deficit over the last couple of years ?

documents.title: self-driving cars might take a while
text: i was at a conference recently , full of the great and the good of the driverless car world and i came away thinking that it 's going to be longer than i originally thought before fully autonomous cars are commonplace on our roads .
why ?
because of humans .
researchers at the university of southampton have been testing people in simulators and on test tracks for years .
they 've been trying to find out how good people are at taking back control when the computer goes wrong .
i had a go in their simulator .

anyway , here are their sobering findings : `` in simulated emergencies , up to a third of drivers of automated vehicles did not recover the situation , whereas almost all drivers of manual vehicles in the same situation were able to do so .
`` in addition , research showed that drivers of automated vehicles took , on average , six times longer to respond to emergency braking of other vehicles compared to manual drivers . ''
read more here .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: abercrombie sales beat forecasts
text: us fashion retailer abercrombie & fitch has reported that like for like sales for the three months to 28 october rose 4 % , due to a rise in sales of its hollister brand of clothing .
total revenue rose to $ 859.1m , compared to $ 821.7m in the same period in 2016 , ahead of analysts ' forecasts .
net income for the third quarter increased to $ 10.1m , compared to $ 7.9m in the same period last year .

documents.title: jaguar land rover tests self-driving car
text: on a lively day for the car industry , jaguar land rover reveals that it has tested its first driverless car on a public road .
the company says that testing the vehicle will help it understand how it interacts with other cars and infrastructure such as traffic lights .
the trial is taking place in coventry where jaguar land rover is headquartered .

nick rogers , jaguar land rover 's executive director for product engineering , tells reuters : `` by using inputs from multiple sensors , and finding intelligent ways to process this data , we are gaining accurate technical insight to pioneer the automotive application of these technologies . ''

documents.title: chevron to push for myanmar human rights
text: after years of pressure from activist investors , chevron says it will work for `` a business environment that respects human rights ''

documents.title: watch : tesla 's new truck
text: tesla has shown off the long awaited tesla semi truck , but surprised many with its new roadster sports car .
elon musk 's company is under intense pressure to meet existing orders before moving on to these new projects .

documents.title: london markets reverse falls
text: the ftse 100 has reversed earlier falls and is now trading up 10.18 points at 7,397.12 .
sky continues to lead the risers , with its shares up 2.6 % to 927p on speculation that comcast and verizon are interested 21st century fox 's 39 % stake in the broadcaster .
on the fallers , united utilities is down 4 % at 800.5p after hsbc cut its rating on the stock to hold .
the ftse 250 is also up , rising 3.20 points at 19,853.20 .

documents.title: john lewis thanks john lewis
text: received a nice package from john lewis ( retail ) again as a thank you for handling wayward tweets , including # mozthemonster and his book , wifi controlled christmas lights , and a google home !
oh , and an edible version of my face !

documents.title: uk will honour its eu commitments , says may
text: prime minister theresa may repeated that the uk will honour its commitments to the european union despite calls from leaders in the bloc to clarify how much britain will pay on brexit .
at a summit in sweden on friday , mrs may said : `` for the negotiations , those continue , and obviously we look forward to the december european council and continuing to look through the issues .
i was clear in my speech in florence that we will honour our commitments .
`` i 've set out a vision for that economic partnership .
i look forward to the european union responding positively to that so we can move forward together . ''

documents.title: and now for something completely differentbbc news and business presenter ben bland tweets
text: moments before going on air # bbcbizlive - and another dog appears in the green room .
also for @ twitterid # caninefriday
how about we introduce a couple of cheeky # shetland ponies from our equine facilitated learning centre to give the green room a new aroma ?
we are having amazing results with troubled and excluded children , please get in touch if you want to find out more

documents.title: 2 sisters hygiene problems 'not one-off '
text: problems at a major uk chicken supplier forced to suspend operations over hygiene concerns were `` not a one-off '' , mps have claimed .
a site run by the 2 sisters food group in the west midlands had a `` far from pristine '' past record , the environment , food and rural affairs committee said .
its month-long inquiry also raised concerns about how the production plant was being monitored by authorities .
read more here .

documents.title: breakinggovernment 'supportive ' of carillion talks
text: the government has issued the following statement in response to a profit warning by carillion which is experiencing financial difficulties .
it says : `` carillion is a major supplier to the government with a number of long-term contracts .
the company has kept us informed of the steps it is taking to restructure the business .
we remain supportive of their ongoing discussions with their stakeholders and await future updates on their progress . ''

documents.title: nissan 's suppliers and dealers to be compensated
text: nissan executives have confirmed that they are currently in talks with suppliers and dealers to discuss compensation over the recall of 1.2 million cars due to a quality control scandal .

`` we understand that the problem [ caused ] great inconvenience , a big burden , significant costs , so we , nissan motor co , will respond to this sincerely , '' a spokesperson said at the press conference .
`` this is what we are communicating to dealers , we are discussing how to earn back customer trust and how to improve the brand , ideas for how to support the dealers are in discussion . ''
another executive confirmed that conversations are ongoing with suppliers as well , and compensation is being discussed on a case-by-case basis .

documents.title: other nissan executives could give back pay too
text: nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa says that his decision to return part of his salary to the car manufacturer is `` entirely voluntary '' , which he decided to do in order to help the company `` recover from the situation '' .
`` the issue of returning the compensation is entirely voluntarily , however other executives are thinking along the same lines , '' he said .
`` i can not elaborate any further . ''

documents.title: questions persist about nissan 's former boss
text: commenting further on his predecessor carlos ghosn , nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa , says : `` we ca n't say that ghosn-style management is the reason for the problems maybe someone realised , but nothing was done .
i do n't know what it was , but the situation was left as it was and it then triggered a bigger problem .
`` what we have to learn is that if you leave things unattended , they can lead to unwanted consequences .
he adds : `` in relation to ghosn management , we have to reflect - why did this not come up ?
we have to change this by education on the leader-side , otherwise this problem can come up again . ''

documents.title: nissan boss drops the mic
text: nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa is undergoing a severe grilling from journalists at the press conference over the quality control scandal .
when asked to explain exactly how much his compensation package is , and how much he is returning to the company , he got upset .
`` today i am voluntarily returning part of my compensation .
actually , no i do n't want to answer anymore , '' he said , turned off his microphone and put it down on the table .

documents.title: beware carillion 's house of horrors
text: `` the carillion horror show continues , '' says nicholas hyett , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown .

he says : `` some sort of recapitalisation was inevitable , but a possible debt for equity swap , with debt even higher than the group had anticipated , is probably as bad as anyone would have guessed .
`` the group has made some progress on asset sales and it sounds like some cost savings are being made .
it 's not what the group expected though , and it 's clearly not enough .
`` it 's also probably irrelevant given the state of the balance sheet , with net debt already many multiples of the group 's market capitalisation . ''

documents.title: where is carlos ghosn ?
text: hiroto saikawa is being asked where carlos ghosn is ?
mr ghosn was chief executive of nissan from 2001 until early this year when mr saikawa took over from him .
mr ghosn is nissan chairman .
`` why is he not here ?
i am the ceo and it is my responsibility to deal with this , '' replied mr saikawa .
`` why did n't people raise hands and ask questions when they saw problems ?
i think mr ghosn has a big question about this in his mind .
`` we did n't do what we should have done , and it became a habit .
the problem was embedded in the shop floor .
`` now that sales are up and orders increasing , this kind of thing will happen .
it was not a new issue , the existing issue just became bigger . ''

documents.title: nissan promises 'surprise audits '
text: nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa says that it is hard to know how long the improper final inspection processes have been going on for at nisssan but it could have been for up to 20 years .

he said that the japanese car manufacturer routinely conducts annual internal audits of all plants to ensure that they are following regulations but around the time of the most recent audits , a number of people were replaced and problems were not detected .
`` the quality control [ part of the ] plant did a self-check .
we usually make advanced notice of the audit so the people in the plant were able to make preparations , but now we 're going for surprise inspections every week , '' mr saikawa said .
`` we have hired a third party company to do the surprise audit every week . ''

documents.title: worst day on record for carillion shares
text: carillion 's shares are now down 30.78 % at 29.25p after it issued its third profit warning this year .
when the stock market opened on friday morning , shocked investors sent the shares down nearly 60 % .

documents.title: elon musk pulls a steve jobs
text: it is not just all about trucks for tesla .
chief executive elon musk unveiled a new version of the roadster sports car , which can accelerate to 60 miles per hour in just 1.9 seconds - faster than the average formula 1 car .
the bbc 's dave lee says : `` one of the things that really , really got people excited here tonight was the surprise unveiling of yet another new car .
in the back of one of the trailers was a new roadster that came rolling out , an almost sort of steve jobs 'one more thing ' from elon musk , and that really raised the roof .
`` people just were n't expecting a new car , and the tesla faithful were extremely excited by that new roadster . ''
however , with a price tag of $ 200,000 ( £ 151,140 ) , the market for the car might be a little limited .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: nissan boss confirms pay return
text: nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa ( has confirmed that he has started returning at least part of his salary since october , in response to the quality control scandal .
`` we need to recover , so i am voluntarily returning part of my compensation , '' he told a press conference in tokyo .
`` [ as for the other executives ] , the board of directors will assess it and give us guidance .
i would like to refrain from elaborating on this . ''

documents.title: ftse indexes fall lower
text: the ftse 100 is now down 13.58 points at 7,373.36 .

sky is the morning 's biggest riser so far , with its share up 2.7 % at 928p , on reports that both comcast and verizon are interested in buying some of twenty-first century fox 's assets , including the satellite broadcaster .
conversely , shire 's share price is the biggest faller , down 2.1 % at £ 36.62 .
it is in talks with mediclinic international .
the ftse 250 is down 82.77 points at 19,767.23 .

documents.title: nissan : japanese work culture to blame
text: nissan 's chief executive hiroto saikawa has blamed japanese culture for the quality control scandal which saw the recall of 1.2 million of its cars .
he said japan has a `` top-down work culture '' where departments exist in `` isolated '' silos and employees do not feel comfortable to speak up when problems are detected .
`` in [ japan ] , where top-down culture is prevalent , this happens but over time people can be changed .
we need to strengthen management , that 's how i see it , '' he said .
`` there are people who feel that even if they say something , management will not listen .
this is not consistent throughout nissan , it depends on the department .
`` we are going to change and make improvements , but we need to change the mindset and communication .
we can not make correction easily , it 's part of a cultural issue , but of course it needs to be corrected . ''

documents.title: brexit is a '27-country decision '
text: brexit negotiations are not just about the uk - other eu countries want the talks to progress because it 's a `` 27-country decision '' , brexit secretary david davis told the bbc in berlin .
he said that many other eu member states view a favourable outcome as important to their economies and seek a `` mutually beneficial future '' .

on the role of the european court of justice during any transition period , mr davis said : `` this is a negotiation about to start the ideal from our point of view is that it starts with the european court and we end up with an arbitration mechanism . ''
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: we need to stop this bad practice , says nissan
text: nissan has held a press conference in tokyo to address its quality control scandal .
`` we need to stop this bad practice that has been lasting for long years and stabilise the inspections , '' said hiroto saikawa , president and chief executive of nissan .
`` education for inspectors is important and we need to assess them.this incident has provoked a lot of distrust and our imminent challenge is to earn back our customers ' trust .
`` we will eradicate this bad practice and identify the hidden issues in the organisation and make improvements .
please give us an opportunity to make amends . ''

documents.title: nissan executives to return pay
text: shares in nissan rose on news that executives of the japanese car manufacturer are likely to return a part of their pay over a quality control scandal .
in october , nissan issued a 1.2 million vehicle recall after discovering that improper final inspection procedures had been used to sign off automobiles .

nissan 's investigation also found that the car manufacturer was using a process to train certified inspectors that was shorter than reported to the japanese transport ministry , while other trainees were provided with answers in advance of certification exams .

documents.title: carillion shares dive
text: shares in carillion have plunged by 59 % to 17p after issuing its third profit warning this year and admitting that it will breach its banking covenants .

documents.title: london stock markets open lower
text: the ftse 100 has opened 15.94 points lower at 7,371.00 .
the ftse 250 is down 9.47 points at 19,840.53 .

documents.title: too big to fail ?
text: where does carillion go from here ?
neil wilson , senior market analyst at etx capital , says : `` some investors might think this is the end , but carillion is too big to fail .
`` government intervention is possible but this is a nightmare for ministers at such a sensitive moment for the economy . ''

he points out that the construction and outsourcing group is hoping that it can delay the next test of its banking agreements to next april by which time carillion hopes to be reaping the benefits of disposals and receipts from contacts .
mr wilson also points out that carillion is still winning contracts , including work on hs2 .
but he says : `` this is little solace for investors . ''

documents.title: credit limits put up without consent
text: more than a million credit card users who are struggling financially have had their credit limits increased without asking , according to citizens advice .
credit card limits 'need control '
increase in limit will help card holders during their financial problem days & encourages to pay dues in priority when situation improves .

documents.title: important to 'show responsibility ' , says sky bet
text: in addition to extending its multi-million pound sponsorship deal with the english football league ( efl ) , sky bet is also launching a `` responsible gambling campaign '' today .
the campaign will see messages discouraging problem gambling printed on shirt sleeves .
the message will also be echoed in a tv advert and seen on perimeter boards at efl games .

`` we do n't have access to the logos on the front of the shirts , that 's up to the clubs to sell to their sponsors , '' richard flint , sky betting & gaming 's chief executive tells bbc 's today programme .
`` this was n't something we were asked to do by the efl .
we think it is important to have a regulated gambling industry sponsoring football , and as a regulated industry , we need to be responsible and show our responsibility . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: significant challenges remain , say carillion
text: keith cochrane , carillion 's interim chief executive , said : `` whilst we continue to target cash collections , reduce costs , execute disposals and focus on delivering for our customers , it is clear that significant challenges remain and more needs to be done to reduce net debt and rebuild the balance sheet .
`` constructive dialogue is continuing with our financial stakeholders , and i am grateful for their support . ''
he added : `` i remain focused on addressing this issue before my successor , andrew davies , takes up the role on 2 april 2018 . ''

documents.title: carillion issues third profit warning
text: infrastructure and construction firm carillion has warned on profits and says it will breach its financial covenants .
under its loan agreement with its lenders , carillion must show that its earnings before interest , tax , depreciation and amortisation ( ebitda ) - or profit - covers its debt by an agreed amount .
however , carillion said it now expected to breach its loan agreements by 31 december .
it said : `` the board is therefore in discussions with stakeholders regarding a broad range of options to further reduce net debt and repair and strengthen the group 's balance sheet . ''

it said that because of a delay in disposals , a significant project in the middle east not starting when expected and lower than expected improvements to certain support services contract `` will lead to profits for the year to 31 december being materially lower than current market expectations '' .
it is the company 's third profit warning this year .
because of all these factors , carillion also said it now expects full year average net borrowing to be between £ 875m and £ 925m .

documents.title: nationwide profits fall
text: nationwide building society has reported a fall in pre-tax profit to £ 628m for the first six months of its financial year , compared to £ 696m in the first half of 2016 .
it said that its mortgage lending rose to £ 15bn for the period to 30 september , up from £ 14.7bn in the same six months last year .
nationwide chief executive joe garner said : `` looking ahead , the uk economy should continue to grow , albeit at a slower rate due to the uncertainties around brexit .
`` despite the recent base rate rise , borrowing costs overall remain low .
however , we know that low wage growth and inflation are putting pressure on household budgets and we remain alert to signs of financial strains on consumers . ''
he added : `` nationwide is in very good shape after another strong set of results .
the second half may bring tougher trading conditions , but we remain well placed to stand by our members in these uncertain times . ''

documents.title: 'not many sponsors for football ' says betting chief
text: commenting on why sky betting & gaming has extended its multi-million pound sponsorship deal with the english football league , the betting company 's chief executive richard flint , says : `` without sponsorship from the betting industry there are n't a great number of sponsors willing to get involved in football . ''
he tells wake up to money that the efl gets revenue from the deal which is then distributed to the football clubs to help them run their day-to-day operations .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: tesla truck not fully autonomous
text: the electric truck might be made by tesla , but it does n't mean that it is a self-driving vehicle .

dave lee , bbc 's north america technology reporter tells the bbc today programme : `` it has some of the autonomous features that tesla 's cars have at the moment , so for example you can turn on a feature called autopilot that can monitor the traffic of cars up ahead and turn down the speed accordingly .

`` it can also quite terrifyingly change lanes sometimes without you having to touch the wheel , but to be fair to tesla these are safety features using many sensors that will in many ways make the truck safer than many of the trucks on the roads today .
`` they see it very much as a safety feature - we 're still quite a way before we have no driver at all . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: from hero to zero
text: ritu vohora , equities investment director at m & g investment , describes the situation at engineering company gkn as `` a bit of a shambles '' .
on thursday , the business announced that its chief executive designate kevin cummings had left before actually taking over the top job amid problems at its us aerospace division .
ms vohora says : `` two months before he started , he 's gone from hero to zero . ''
more importantly , she says that a review of its us aerospace business has highlighted how gkn reports its inventory and how it accounts for working capital .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: have power , will travel
text: as we reported earlier , tesla has launched its first electric truck that can accelerate to 60 miles per hour in just five seconds .

dave lee , bbc 's north america technology reporter , who was at the launch , tells the bbc 's today programme : `` one of the things people were concerned about before this launch was whether the truck would have a long enough range to make it worthwhile , because you do n't want to be stopping every 100 miles to charge it . ''
tesla says that the vehicle can go 400 miles on 30 minutes of charging , and if it 's fully charged , it can go 500 miles .

he said : `` that 's certainly impressing many people here , so because of that , elon musk thinks he 's got a real good thing here that could challenge the diesel infrastructure that we have currently . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: a painful squeeze on spending
text: as the spectre of the black friday sales rear its head , wake up to money wonders whether retailers should be concerned about figures showing that retail sales fell by 0.3 % in october .

ritu vohora , equities investment director at m & g investment , points out that retail sales were strong in october last year , making comparisons tough , and said that trade over the last three months was up 0.9 % .
however she says that `` 50 % of retailers on the high street have seen a drop in sales '' .
she says that the key issue is inflation and that in particular that food prices have risen .
`` consumers are continuing to feel the squeeze , '' she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: sky bet extends efl sponsorship deal
text: sky betting & gaming has extended its multi-million pound sponsorship deal with the english football league until the summer of 2024 .
the gambling operation is the headline sponsor for the championship , league one and league two football divisions .
it gets its logo on shirts , and rights for `` bet and watch '' for some matches .
it says it will try to discourage problem gambling through messaging on shirts , and that clubs will benefit through more money .
read the full story here .

documents.title: brexit top of the agenda for may in sweden
text: prime minister theresa may is set to meet european council president donald tusk in sweden on friday when she is expected to face calls for more clarity about how the uk intends to settle the first phase of brexit negotiations .
she will hold meetings on the sidelines of an eu summit , to try to secure an agreement that would enable discussions about a post-brexit trade deal to begin next month .

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to business live .
on friday , nationwide building society will report its interim results which is timely given that housing - or the lack of - will be a central theme in next week 's budget .
for everything you could possibly need to know about the budget on wednesday , 22 november click here .
as always we 'd love to hear from you .
email us here at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
